pages.text: If you were to slay a Bat while wearing both the Helm and Robe, you obtain it's webbed carcass. If you were to feed a Spider with these carcasses, while still wearing the two of course, you would be able to tame one!
Tamed Spiders, or Loyal Spiders, will come with a Collar that you can dye and can be ordered to sit like a tamed Wolf.

Giving Loyal Spiders certain potions gives them some special attributes. A Poison Potion will turn them smaller and weaker, but will give them the ability to imbue poison upon your foes. A Slow Falling Potion makes them immune to Fall Damage.

They will grow stronger each time you feed them a Raw Mutated Meat, levelling up in a sense, increasing their Max Health and Attack Damage though they will stop growing stronger after being fed 10 times. The meat also heals 5 Hearts of damage.

After 4 or so times of being fed mutated meat, they can be saddled and be ridden. After reaching their maximum level, they will become Royal Spiders, which can command Spiders into attack its enemies.

Wearing both Helm and Robe also allows your Spider(s) to heal using the Soul Energy from your Totem. If you have multiple Loyal Spiders, feeding them a Carrion Bat will cause them to breed and make a new Loyal Spider. However, when breeding, one of the Spiders will attack on another, dealing a large amount of damage and giving Weakness Effect. Throw a Slowness Potion at them to stop their cannibalism.
